result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien S H Seckar Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall maintain full time employment.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 30 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits. If not maintaining full time employment, pursue an educational program.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant to provide DNA Sample and pay fee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damien S H Seckar Anderson

Defendant Damien S H Seckar Anderson in court with attorney Raymond L. Edelstein.  Stephanie A. Stauber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Damien S H Seckar Anderson in court with attorney Raymond L. Edelstein.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed by Physician.  Report to the Winnebago County Jail for fingerprinting and photo pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7).
Defendant Damien S H Seckar Anderson in court with attorney Raymond L. Edelstein.  Scott A. Ceman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
